title: (29560) Pizarra - Unnamed Road
description: Small car park near the fuente (fountain) Luna. Great views. very busy during the day. Quiet at night. Traffic resumes at 5:30 a.m. About. 1 car every 15-20 minutes. Access by a very passable track. Excellent water and beautiful walks, including a prehistoric necropolis.

name: Camping Park Pizarra
title: (29569) Camping Park Pizarra
description:
The campsite has a beautiful location, but the road to it is far from ideal. As soon as you exchange the paved road for the dirt road, you go up quite steeply. It is only to be hoped that you do not meet an oncoming car, because there is really no room for that. Campers will suffer from overhanging branches. Once at the campsite it goes down quite steeply. Many campers will have trouble getting out again. Especially large and heavy campers. I have a 4x4 truck, but I wouldn't do it again.

It is very expensive for a camper overnight. One camper with 1 person including electricity and tax pays almost 19 euros. Taking water is not possible. There is a shower and a toilet.

The British owner is very friendly. It is open all year round.

Unfortunately for campers this is not recommended due to the poor accessibility.

name: La Casa Palmera
title: (29560) La Casa Palmera
description: La Casa Palmera offers two full service pitches with soft/hard standing suitable for motor homes of up to 10mtrs and twin axle caravans with motor movers. Both pitches are part shaded with olive trees in our house grounds. Access is off the main tarmac road and onto a concrete private road for 30 yards. Access is through 3 metre wide electric gates and guided reverse park is recommended. Plenty of space for towed car/bikes and awning. The facilities include a washroom used by both pitches, which includes washing sink and toilet, walk in shower, sink for washing up etc. and a washing machine. Each pitch has taps with cold running water and a waste disposal is a few yards away. Bins are provided for general rubbish. We have a fantastic pool which is used by guests staying at the apartments we have and house guests that may be staying. There is a chill out/reading/soft seating area and dining table. We may consider long term stays and seasonal pitches. We require 24 hrs notice when booking. The area offers stunning and dramatic mountains and is only a 5 minute drive or half an hour walk to the nearest bar offering typical Spanish tapas. Pizarra is our nearest very Spanish town and from here you can catch the train to the Caminito del Rey or into Malaga City. It really is the ideal spot to explore the beautiful Andalusia region. And only 25 mins from the nearest beach!!

title: (29570) Casapalma -
description: Flat plot with lots of shade near the Rio Grande on the outskirts of Malaga. You can spend the night. cool place for harsh summer days.

title: (29510) Barriada Estación - 26 Calle Estación E
description: Large back of flat land. there are walks to do next to the river. Good internet coverage. easy access for all types of vehicles. people come for a walk and kids at night to make thrombos but it's not every day. I have had two good nights. in the neighborhood next door there are shops and bars to go on foot. It is not the quietest place because other people are the train that passes on the other side of the river

title: (29500) Álora - 162 Diseminado Poligono 18
description: At the heliport above the cemetery, amazing views, quiet area but it looks like it's an area for lovers by car, a lot of paper lying on the ground.

title: (29500) Álora - 1 Calle Benito Suárez
description: Drinking water fountain next to the church. Delicious without chlorine. Attention: access only suitable for vans, small streets.

title: (29500) Álora - 162 Diseminado Poligono 18
description: In the middle of nature just behind the cemetery, large parking lot on asphalt ground. Breathtaking view of village and castle. Very calm at night. During the day passage planes but not disturbing. Water possibly in the cemetery during the day, cemetery which closes at 8 p.m.

title: (29500) Álora - 240 Partido San José
description: Carmona street car park. Open space without light, water or drain. Monday from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. (street market). With night light of street lamps. Best place to park and go to the center of town. there is water and a gray water drain and WC. Overall fairly calm, there are worse. Be careful when you go up the hill, pick up speed, it is steep. flat parking with calles.

title: (29500) Álora - 7 Calle Corta
description: Madese Self-Service Laundry - Lavomatic

title: (29500) Álora - Lugar Conjunto San Jorge, 3
description: Nice drinking water. you can park right next to it to connect a hose to it.

title: (29500) Álora - 119 Urbanizacion Ur. 2
description: Perfect parking with good views. Quiet area and close to Avda Cervantes, the main one of the town. Health center next door. Sports Center. Supermarkets Restaurants. Cervantes stationery-toy store very close. Spare parts nearby. No light, no water, no drains. Containers next.

title: (29500) Álora - Unnamed Road
description:
Beautiful and quiet place, lonely with a beautiful view of the valley and town of Alora.
Just to rest under pine trees and enjoy. Two camping tables and a beautiful rock formation. Flat.
Path somewhat narrow but suitable for motorhomes up to 6 meters. It seems worse than it is.
No services, no water, just peace and very good internet.

title: (29580) Cártama - 13 Avenida Loma Tres Leguas
description: Place in quiet neighborhood. Nothing special.

title: (29510) Álora - 161 Diseminado Poligono 8
description: Very isolated and calm place. Next to the hermitage, the three crosses. A magnificent view of the Guadalhorce Valley. Not recommended for motorhomes as the road is a bit winding.

title: (29580) Cártama - 19 Calle San Miguel
description: Tree-lined area of pine trees, close to the road without much traffic. A lot of shadow Quiet zone.

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 6 Lugar los Chozones
title_short: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 6 Lugar los Chozones
description: Los Chozones is a small tranquil site for adults only. No smoking. It has beautiful gardens, plenty of space and very central to visit Malaga or Marbella

name: Mariposa libre
title: (29570) Mariposa libre
description:
Mariposa Libre has room for 6 campers. Price parking is incl. 2 persons
You can use the bathroom with sink, toilet and shower, kitchen for cooking and / or washing up. Hot tub, swimming pool with sunbeds and beautiful views over the mountains. The swimming pool is closed in winter.


The owners are super friendly.
Calling in advance is recommended.
Languages : Dutch, English, Spanish and German

title: (29580) Cártama - 2 Calle Robles
description: Picnic area near the river. there  are about 40 grills, so probably busy on the weekend. plenty of shaded space. Spent one quiet night

title: (29580) Estación de Cártama - 1 Calle Jose Martin Ruiz
title_short: (29580) Estación de Cártama - 1 Calle Jose Martin Ruiz
description: Large esplanade without service where to park and spend the night. behind a health center and mayor's office. two streets up we find several bars for coffee, drinks and restaurants where we can eat and dine ..

title: (29566) Casarabonela - 6 Diseminado Arroyo Cañas
description: Petrol station with possibility to wash campers

title: (29570) Cártama - 3 La Mata
description: Large plot of land with several olive trees, between a school and the Cártama cemetery, where you can get water from the fountain. At 200m is the town, supermarket, cafeteria and restaurant. It is a mountain town, Church, wall, hermitage.

title: (29570) Cártama - 7-9 Calle Limnol
description: Stalemate in urbanization at the end. There is no altededor of services. A bar / pub and a village service pizzeria of 250m and 750m

title: (29570) - 1A Avenida Feria
description: Playground and picnic area

title: (29570) Cártama - 29 Arrabal Ur-1 Pueblo
description: Public parking in front of the sports center. In front you have a Lidl and an Aldi. Services in the sports center when it is open. Fountain with drinking water.

title: (29566) - 25 Partida Martina
description:
Amandolas Rural Estate. With Bar And Splash Pool Now Open. Toilet And Shower Facilities.BBQ .  Mountain Views, 700 Meters From The Main Road, Quiet And Peaceful.
Food Available

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 146 Urbanización Sierra Gorda
title_short: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 146 Urbanización Sierra Gorda
description:
A dead end street away from houses, overlooking an amazing view 360 degrees around.

No services except for the spectacular view. Take your trash with you.

No parking forbidden signs anywhere.

title: (29100) Coín - 2 Calle Guadalquivir
description: Laundromat, gas Repsol and Cespa

title: (29100) Coín - 10 Cortijo Benitez
description: Along the river there is a small gravel road with some nice spots. Cars are passing the road so be aware your not all alone there.

title: (29100) Miralmonte -
description: Our Wonder Casa Rural La Alegría is the ideal place where you can spend the night or several nights. Located in a privileged natural environment surrounded by nature, just 10 minutes from a shopping center (Carrefour, cinemas, etc.) and 30 minutes from the beach, airport and the tourist center of Malaga. The house has a large outdoor parking area. The private pool available throughout the year is located in a large garden with a barbecue area and a large outdoor space to enjoy. (Trampoline, basketball basket, sun loungers...) We have a washing machine and drying rack for the traveler who needs to clean their clothes with a supplement of 5 euros. Just as they can use the shower to clean themselves if they need to with an extra 3 euros. Welcome (elderly, adults, youth, adolescents, children and babies) to our rural house. Send an email to check availability.

title: (29593) Bermejo - Tr.ª Chorro Bermejo
description: Drinking Water. No hose connector

title: (29100) Coín - 1 Calle Guttenberg
description: Free parking for campers and caravans in the Cantarranas industrial area. The site has toilet cistern emptying, sewage disposal and water supply. The residual waste containers are located on the road above the parking lot towards the main road and on the road leading to the depot. Four supermarkets are on their way to the city within 900 meters. The city center and the "La Trocha" shopping center are both 1.5 km away.

title: (29566) Casarabonela - 2 Calle Funcionario Paco Mutilado
description: Drinking fountain, good unchlorinated water

title: (29566) Casarabonela - 14 Lugar Partido Raja Vieja
description: Place to rest on the outskirts of Casarabonela. Right next to the soccer field. Nice views

title: (29100) Coín - 2A Avenida Reina Sofía
description: Laundrette at the Repsol garage. Small parking spaces so perhaps use car park immediately below garage.

title: (29100) Coín - 11 Lugar Partido las Angosturas
description: Just a big carpark, handy for Guaro and Coin,  mainly flat, by a not too busy road. local we spoke to refered to it as a fairground. Quiet at night. No services

name: Andes el Grande
title: (29120) Andes el Grande
description: Andes El Grande is a hostel / airbnb / camper place where you can enjoy hostel life, but still sleep in your camper. You can use internet, shower, toilets, swimming pool, etc. for €15/night. Andes El Grande is a magical place, recommended!

title: (29100) Coín - 1 Calle Clara Campoamor
description: Very wide parking near the city centre. A little next to the road, but you can park more inside. No facilities, but very nice!

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre -
description: Gas station with Cepsa propane bottles and free non-drinking water It has a shop to buy and a bar

title: (29100) Coín - 1Z Camino Huertas Viejas
description: Solar used to park, next to the Civil Guard barracks, near the urban center.

title: (29566) Casarabonela - Cam. del Naranjal
description: Nice place to spend the night with great views. There are picnic tables

title: (29100) Coín - Carretera de Monda
description: Ample parking area in the center of town, with easy access to bars, restaurants and supply stores less than 5 min walk. Dirt floor, lots of dust. Quiet place to sleep during the week; bad place for holidays or weekends because you hear a lot of noise from the pub next door.

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 2 Calle Gonzalez Madrid
title_short: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 2 Calle Gonzalez Madrid
description: Big levelled parking close to Guardia Civil, the Theatre and back intrance of Mercadona. Fleamarket Thursday Morning (parking not allowed then). Passing Traffic limited to 40 km/h.

title: (29551) Carratraca - 74 A-7277
description: Fountain with drinking water in the village of Carratraca. Even though there is a sign of “agua no tratada”, I have been drinking this water all my life and it’s good :) Can’t connect a hose to the fountain but you can fill up with water bottles.

title: (29590) Málaga - 2 Calle Graham Bell
description: Laundry and dryer machines in the repsol gas station. Small parking area in front of the area.

title: (29108) Guaro - 277 Diseminado Diseminados
description: At the edge of a small river at the intersection of 2 paths. Road a little dented but passable by everyone. 3/4 places near the ford very quiet ... No prohibition sign and no service against.

title: (29100) Coín - 64 Terreno SUP.R.18
description: Large gravelled car park. Good for the night.

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 43 A-404
description: Spacious parking close to bakeries, mountains and where you can leave your motorhome

title: (29593) Bermejo-Caracuel - MA-447
description: Old abandoned parking lot. The lower part is fenced but the upper part is freely accessible asphalt area.

title: (29130) Málaga - 6M Terreno Ur
description: Nothing special. Industrial estate but very open and nicer than others I've had to sleep in. good coverage and savings to walk a little with the dog. Quiet night even on a Friday night. no services

title: (29567) Alozaina - 21 Calle Camino del Mercado
description: Flat parking in a town where everything is slopes. Silent at night and with good views.

title: (29567) Alozaina - 78 Calle Calvario
description: Newly paved street, with a parking place for day and night, without space problem. very quiet and with good views. except on Tuesdays when you cannot park in an area of the street due to the flea market

title: (29567) Alozaina - 96 Calle Calvario
description: Gas station with diesel very well priced. We asked him to fill the water tank and he even provided us with a hose and he did not want to charge us anything ... I recommend consuming there and favoring trade. The owner is kind and helpful.

name: Camping Málaga Monte Parc
title: (29130) Camping Málaga Monte Parc
description:
Welcome to Camping Málaga Monte Parc.

We are located in Alhaurín de la Torre, found on the outskirts on the A404. 20KM away from Málaga Centro.

We are an in-land campsite, "en el campo", but local items include Alhaurín de la Torre and Alhaurín el Grande, both a 5 minute drive away. Lauro Golf is around the corner 5 minutes away, with Málaga Centro being easily accessible with a 20 minute drive. The beach is also around 15km away, with Los Alamos and Playa Guadalhorce being the closest.

We require a 3 night minimum stay however it is possible to stay 1-2 nights but there is a 20% supplement. 

For any further information, please consult our website or call us.

address.city: Alhaurín de la Torre, Arroyo Hondo S/N

name: Casa La Paz
title: (29552) Casa La Paz
description: A bit remote but beautiful place in the mountains near the Caminito del Rey. Access via dirt roads a bit bumpy, only suitable for smaller campers. Note the small signs "Casa del Paz". 15 mins walk to local bar and restaurant. 3 km from El Chorro train station giving access to the coast and surrounding tourist sites.

title: (29150) Almogía - 815 Diseminado Diseminados
description:
Just outside the village of Almogia.
ideal for camper vans only.  We are about 30 km from the airport. Cash only.
Check in from 5 pm to 7:30pm, 
check out by 11am. No more then 3 nights a week allowed.
Registration at check in requires your ID.

 Shower 4€,
1 person and his van 7€, every extra person 4€. Dog 3€. Washing machine 45 minutes wash 4€.
 
Thank you!

title: (29150) Almogía - 4 Calle Don Diego Gaitan San Esteban
title_short: (29150) Almogía - 4 Calle Don Diego Gaitan San Esteban
description: Flat parking, quiet and comfortable. 5 minutes from the historic center.

address.street: 4 Calle Don Diego Gaitan San Esteban

title: (29100) Coín - 2 Lugar Partido Pereila Alta
description: Large parking lot at the church.

title: (29108) Guaro -
description:
Great spot for a lay over, you cn park right next to the river, take a swim if you like as there is a little dam, ple tu of fish and wildlife.

There is a chiringuito/venta at the entrance selling food and drinks. Any type of vehicle can get here, it is close to the road, you can heat cars but it is very peaceful.

name: Finca la Campana
title: (29552) Finca la Campana
description: Finca la Campana offers space for approximately 15 mobile homes. You can use a lot for this: there is a large common room with sofas, a pool table, a table tennis table and table football, a large kitchen and a pizza oven outside. There is a small climbing wall, a slackline, a trampoline and a swimming pool. the owner is very friendly and uncomplicated. The driveway and parking spaces are designed for smaller motorhomes, but up to 6m can be accommodated well.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-448
description: Parking just off the road.  Off season so very quite.   Great views and not much else.  Unsure if it’s ok for overnight.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-448
description: Mirador Tajo Encantada. Small parking and turning area as the road ends here. NOT recommended for overnight- stay! Just turn and drive back half the way to an official parking on your left (going down).

title: (29552) Álora - 25 Diseminado Poligono 2
description: Small area presumably made for and used while resurfacing the road. May still be in use during the week. Seems fine for parking at the weekend, didn’t stay for the night.

title: (29590) Málaga - 16A Avenida José Ortega y Gasset
title_short: (29590) Málaga - 16A Avenida José Ortega y Gasset
description: 3 washing machines of 8 kg, 2 washing machines of 14 kg and 4 dryers on the site of a garage, 24/7

title: (29100) Málaga - 181 Lugar Partido Valdeperales
description: In the middle of a large forest, surrounded by pine trees, next to a football stadium. Very quiet at night. Along the GR 249. No facilities, but there is a water point at the entrance to the stadium. There is plenty of space to park. Be careful, do not follow the GPS here because it indicates closed or impassable paths by van or CC. On the MA-3303, south of the interchange with the A-355, take the small road towards "Nacimiento" and "Ciudad Deportivo". The 3rd path on the left leads to the "Ciudad Deportivo", but the official path, with a sign at the crossroads, is further: continue on the small road following the signs "Ciudad Deportivo" There is a mountain bike center nearby and tracks in the woods. Also a riding place near Nacimiento.

title: (29552) Alora, Andalusia - 12 Diseminado Poligono 24
description: path

title: (29552) El Chorro -
description: Straight pitch under trees with a beautiful view

title: (29150) El Curato - MA-3403
description: It looks like a waste ground for a pilgrimage, near Almogia. It has no services but it is quite level

title: (29552) Álora - MA-5403
description: Quiet, parking with a lot of shade. No swimming allowed in this lake as there are metal constructions in the water!

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-448
description: Mirador to Bobastro in face el Choro... Water retention. Parking, flat. Beautiful, dominant view on the whole region. Close access but easy crossing road. Van 6 m.

title: (29552) Álora - 45 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Small place near road, for 3 vans or shorter campervan. There are few places along road used by climbers. Quiet at day, very quiet by night. No services at all.

title: (29552) El Chorro - 61 Barriada Estación del Chorro
title_short: (29552) El Chorro - 61 Barriada Estación del Chorro
description: Drinking water tap.

title: (29552) Álora - 45 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Very good water. If you turn around bravely and have the right water -thiev you can even fill your tank.

title: (29130) Pinos de Alhaurín - 55D Calle Manuel Aleixandre
title_short: (29130) Pinos de Alhaurín - 55D Calle Manuel Aleixandre
description: Good place to spend the night. Next to Venta Vázquez. Where you can have breakfast before going out to cycle in the mountains or hiking.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - A-404
description: Nice spot for a day or night at the start of many hikes and great downhill/enduro mountain biking. Further up is another spot but takes more climbing on gravel. Disadvantages: close to a shooting range, so during the day you hear them. Close to the street but very quiet at night. Perfect to quickly park and do a big hike. The owners of the restaurants uphill are super friendly and no problem to refill water if you ask. Spot probably not available in the weekend because it gets very busy than.

title: (29590) Málaga - Carretera de cartama, km. 8,3
description:
Carcampa, easy disposal of gray and black water, fresh water.
 Currently under renovation, attached Carcampa permanent parking, repair service, camping items
The website says Carcampa, the sign on the wall Cercampa

title: (29552) Álora - 39 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Small space to park. No services. Spectacular base area for climbing and hiking.

title: (29552) El Chorro -
description: Well with thread to connect a hose

title: (29552) El Chorro -
description: Superb view, place in the middle of nature, plan everything you need! Beware of tires, some rocks that come out of the ground, leave the place clean, this place is great! Accessible by a small path that starts from the road that goes up to the upper lake.

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 39 Urbanizacion UR9
description: An easily accessible large plateau on a hill. Directly at the Castillo histórico alhaurin el grande. Please collect some garbage! There are a lot of shards and mirror splinters lying around that could cause a fire...

title: (29593) Álora - 206 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Nice place with good views all around. On a gravel side road near the ruin of a house. Only had lunch here but would definitely stay overnight if convenient. Only suitable for smaller campers.

title: (29552) El Chorro - Unnamed Road
description: Dirt parking right next to the via Ferrata and climbing routes, as well as the train tracks. There’s a VERY bumpy dirt track to get to the parking. You access by taking the tiny road just to the left of the La Estación De El Chorro snack place, just before the road turns left down to the bus stop and eventually kiosk from caminito del rey. Keep driving down the tiny road, past a small disabled car park, then turn right up the hill, when you get to a fork with a green sign, hand left and drive the dirt track all the way to the top. DEFINITELY not suitable for motorhomes, but a van or car with good ground clearance can make it. We had no problem with careful driving in an L4 Fiat Ducato (6m).

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 15 Avenida Isaac Peral
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 15 Avenida Isaac Peral
description: Good place to spend the night near Sierra Cártama

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - Sn Avenida Ciudad de Ceuta
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - Sn Avenida Ciudad de Ceuta
description: Parking in Lidl supermarket next to gas station

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 29 Urbanizacion UR9
description: Large and quiet car park, nice views, the noise from the road can be heard very lightly. It looks like a kind of maze, you can drive even further down. It appears to be under construction with open manhole covers here and there, so drive carefully. There is a forest on the other side of the road where you can go for a walk. 30 minutes from Málaga.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 16 Calle Miguel de Unamuno
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 16 Calle Miguel de Unamuno
description: Fairground ideal for visiting the town

title: (29108) Guaro -
description: Little picnic spot on the side of the road. No signs and looks like allowed to sleep over. Little noisy with the road next to but very quite road in general so.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre -
description: Las Americas gas station laundromat

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 5 Calle San Miguel
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 5 Calle San Miguel
description: Laundromat very practical there is even a washing machine for dog blankets

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 9 Zona Ue-Pa-02
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 9 Zona Ue-Pa-02
description: Pressure car wash for vehicles up to 3.10 m high, with a gun for tires and a platform on one side for better access to the roof. It works with coins and has a coin exchange machine.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 1 Zona Ur-es-02
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 1 Zona Ur-es-02
description: Along a park with games for children, near the center of Alhaurin de la Torre, accessible on foot. address: Av. Mar. Cantabrico

title: (29109) Málaga - 23 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Space for two or three caravans on a level area by the river Grande. It is alongside a small bridge and there's a tiny stone dam so you can swim. We saw three otters at night. The entrance is difficult for AC entry (motorhomes) as it is narrow and briefly very steep. But if you continue along the road upstream there are loads more pools and maybe ok for motorhomes overnight.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 1 Camino Angostura de la Capellania
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 1 Camino Angostura de la Capellania
description: Parking with some shade, near a low cost gas station. I think it may be fine also for summer.

title: (29550) Ardales - 8 Calle Córdoba
description: Drinking water source.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 15 Zona Ue-en-03
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 15 Zona Ue-en-03
description: Free (non-potable) water, free air for wheels.

title: (29550) Ardales - Unnamed Road
description: Space also easy to reach for small vans.

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description:
Parking next to a flow meter.
I have not seen any kind of sign prohibiting overnight stays.
The noise of the stream is heard.
Close to the road.
It is entered by a dirt road .

title: (29550) Ardales - 6 Camíno del Cantínero
description: Esplanade of land quite spacious and very quiet at the entrance of the village of Ardales. Supermarket and restaurants nearby. Ideal for overnight stay.

title: (29550) Ardales - 38 Camino del Rio
description: Another drinking fountain in the city (the other one is more busy and less parking). Water tastes good without chlorine

title: (29550) Ardales - 28 Terreno AR-1
description: Drinking water. across the street, park in the gravel lot and fill up the portable water tank or drinking bottle next to the graveyard. no hose connection

title: (29004) Málaga - Diseminado R20
description:
We parked here for one night before leaving our camper at ECP, 5 mins further
If you disregard the noice from the planes it's a nice spot
Bit bumby and dusty road to get there

title: (29190) Málaga - 21 Diseminado R31
description: Just off a minor road. Very quiet night. Close to get into Malaga. Great for one night as there's nothing here.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 1 Calle Ur14 Manantiales Altos
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 1 Calle Ur14 Manantiales Altos
description: Quiet parking

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Nice place. Accessible dirt road with some bumps, if you go slowly, all types of vehicles can access.

title: (29120) Alhaurín el Grande - 38A Urbanizacion UR11
description: Excellent starting point for visiting the river in the canyon with pools of water "barranco blanco"

title: (29240) Valle de Abdalajís -
description: A very comfortable place to picnic and sleep, with water and barbecues, and is also very quiet. A bit hilly acces but very quiet in night.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Parking only, along the road, quiet night no passage from 11:30 p.m. to 7 a.m.

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description: Quiet place next to the marsh of casasola.Almogia. without any service but with beautiful views. ideal place to rest and continue on a route of the towns of Malaga

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description: Turn off the main road and follow the track down a slope and over an old bridge. Flat ground, further from the road and more secluded than the other one. Wouldnt recommend in the wet or with a large motorhome.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Picturesque location overlooking the lake. Place for about six motorhomes. Exposed to the wind. No service, no trash-can.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Dirt road that goes to the left, as you go along the road that leads to the Caminito del Rey, you reach a small esplanade, somewhat inclined, you can spend the day and spend the night There is an area of trees that provides shade but enough inclined.

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Difficult to access but we managed with our motorhome. Superb view of the lake.

title: (29190) Málaga - A-7075
description: Small plain. Access 70 m by dirt track. A small section of 10m a little inclined not recommended with ac if it rains a lot.

title: (29650) Mijas -
description: Quiet spot in the large car park at the end of the road. A beautiful view and the beginning of a number of hiking and mountain biking trails. There's also a former quarry, now lined with trees, where we saw a deer. These are the hills where James Bond flew the gyrocopter Little Nellie in You Only Live Twice!

name: Ermita San Roque
title: (29109) Ermita San Roque
description: Picnic area with 4-5 tables, very nice view of Tolox. Water source. Drinking water tap between the toilets and the Chapel. WC closed in winter

title: (29550) Ardales - MA-5403
description: Nice wild spot with epic view of the lake! A bit windy but beautiful landscape.. The unpaved road is easy and short!

title: (29109) Tolox - A-7250
description: Rest area with tables, trees and offset from the road (not very busy). Nice panoramic view of Tolox and its surroundings (cannot be seen in the photos because the weather was not nice ...). No services but source nearby! About ten places horizontally.

title: (29550) Ardales - A-357
description: Very nice public area in the forest, right next to the turquoise blue river that flows into the lake and where turtles and carp have fun. There are "no fire" signs everywhere. There are several working water taps, garbage cans, large garbage cans, and plenty of space to park between the trees. Magnificent place. However, I did not spend a night here, as we had found another parking space by the lake.

title: (29550) Ardales - Ermita de Villaverde, 25
description: Drink water

title: (29550) Ardales - Unnamed Road
description: Great spot for the day. For fishing prohibited to make fires and to camp. Slightly difficult track to reach it but in 7M it passes. Some shady corner. A place of celebration, the rubbish and the vestige of fire bear witness to this. End of summer mud bath possible? With beautiful sunset We have to spend the night

title: (29650) Mijas - 6J Carretera Coín
description: Van parking area. Flat, nice view. Be careful, take the lower path and go back up the esplanade in reverse.

title: (29550) Ardales - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful site in the middle of nature. Great for day or night. An access by dirt track and a steep but short slope at the end. Enjoy and Take Care of the World that we only have this ...

title: (29150) Almogía - A-7075
description: Take the second path, the one without concrete. Once at the top you have a beautiful place high up overlooking the lake! On the other hand we have the road next to it, but very little traffic in the evening. We are slightly visible from the road, but it is a very nice place.

title: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 60 Calle Santa Barbara
title_short: (29130) Alhaurín de la Torre - 60 Calle Santa Barbara
description: Large parking bay in a quiet residential street.  Good place to stop overnight if you have a large motorhome. Good dog walking area alongside the road. Aldi & petrol station just up the road

name: Camping Parque Ardales
title: (29550) Camping Parque Ardales
description: 15 pitches for motorhomes near the beach of a lake. Small but well maintained sanitary facilities. Avoid weekends as many dump stations visit Los Gaitanes Parade (3km from camp) convenience store. Staggered camping but fairly flat camping pitches.

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Stopping point to reach the caminito in 1.5 km. park off the road.

title: () Málaga -
description: Wide parking place at 6 km from Málaga, with benches and trash bins, amongst olive trees. Quiet during the night.

title: (29130) - 3C Terreno Ur
description: Quiet place, but without services. Good to spend a night. You can go mountain biking and trail runing around. There is an Aldi at 100m

title: (29550) Ardales -
description: Up to here you can access with the motorhome. Walking for a while there is still some of the reservoir. At least we were able to stop and rest without anyone around. Ideal for dogs, to walk and continue tomorrow.

title: (29550) Ardales - Unnamed Road
description: Nice secluded place. Unfortunately the lake is half dry, but you still have a wonderful view. You can enjoy both the sunset and sunrise. It's a bit tricky to get there, but with a bit of skill and a second one who can navigate past the stones, it's not a problem. We got there without any problems with a Renault Master. The shepherd just drove by every now and then and greeted us warmly, so that wasn't a problem either. There are several options around this peninsula to park the car, there was another camper with us on the other side of the island.

title: (29320) Gobantes - Unnamed Road
description: Excellent place to spend the day! (Only during the day! Closed at night!) They have tables and barbecues (not always enabled). you can rent kayaks, boats and paddle surf. cheap price!

title: (29110) Monda - 7B Calle Higuera
description:
Parking in the center of the city. Important. It is shared with cars, it is usually quite busy during the day, Tuesday is market day until 2pm so avoid the area at all costs.

You are OK to park for one night, however, not for large motor homes as it is a small but bustling village.

There are water fountains in the village where you can fill up your water bottles and have a little tapa!

title: (29650) Mijas - 14 Urbanización Huerta Alta I
description: Parking with bus shuttle from 12 to 01 for Mijas super large parking 200 or more vehicles of all kinds.

title: (29650) Mijas - 8 Via Ue S24 el Cerrajon
title_short: (29650) Mijas - 8 Via Ue S24 el Cerrajon
description: Nice parking for 3 or 4 caravans, nice sunsets and right in front of hiking trails.

title: (29410) Yunquera - 2 Partida las Canchas
description: Here you can fill water

title: (29190) Málaga - 4 Calle Jorge E. Loring Oyarzábal
title_short: (29190) Málaga - 4 Calle Jorge E. Loring Oyarzábal
description: Gas station that has adblue, LPG and Lavomatic automatic laundry

title: (29591) Málaga - Avenida Andersen
description: Parking in Virgen de Las Cañas Park

title: (29110) Monda - s/n Camino Hoyanca
description: In Monda. Near the road that connects Coin with Marbella. It is a parking lot for a design school. Desert in summer. There are 2 security cameras (but no alarm function). The highway ends in that parking lot and a farm, nobody is disturbed.

title: (29190) Málaga - 12 Calle Pirita
description: Barrier-free public parking. Free admission. Tuesdays is market day and they occupy the area very early. There are no camper services, but right next door you have a pharmacy and places to eat.

title: (29109) Tolox - 29 Camino Nuevo
description: Quiet place to spend the night, somewhat level and lit. Place to start the trail of the waterfalls that is found when crossing the town, in this way it is used to enjoy the charm of Tolox

title: (29550) Ardales -
description: Parking to spend the night in the king's road is quiet for about four seats a bit on the slope ideal to leave the motorhome parked and go on foot to the meeting place of the route

title: (29004) Málaga - 48 Calle Torre del Mar
description: No Facilities

title: (29550) Ardales - El Caminito del Rey
description: Parking to visit the Camino del Rey 200m from the north access and 500m from the return shuttle stop, be careful it has arrived for luck if the cars do not take all the places. Three mobile homes are let in. Open from 8:30 a.m. Locked with a chain at night.

title: (29550) Málaga - Unnamed Road
description: There are 3 to 4 places along the road. Absolutely quiet in the night. 20mtrs from the tunel. Easy to find a place on Monday when Canimito is closed. You are then the closest possible to the entrance on Tuesday where we were shortly after 8 a. M. And we were lucky to be among the first ones in the row to get the few free tickets for the day. You can also enjoy swimming in the lake just about 50mtrs.

title: (29650) Mijas - 123 Carretera Mijas-Fuengirola
description: Free water point and paid laundry place for campers.

title: (29650) Mijas -
description: Just a tiny pull of on this beautiful road on the side of the Mijas mountain. Only room for 1 van, maybe 2. It’s right next to the road so not so quite, but amazing for a morning coffee or a lunch. Amazing view.

title: (29320) Gobantes - Unnamed Road
description: Parking for Caminito del rey. It’s near the north site witch it’s the start. Shuttle bus when you finish the Caminito del rey

title: (29110) Monda - 79 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Perfect for a meal or to spend the night

title: (29650) Mijas - 11D Calle Tamisa
description: Free parking 2 minutes walk from the center of Mijas, very little crowded and flat. We spent one night there and it was very good.

title: (29550) Ardales - 5 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description: Small corner in the nature above the lakes and dams and above the departure of the Caminoto del Rey. Access by an earth road upstream of the tunnel on the right downhill. Ideal for Van, delicate access for camper. View of the sunset, at the top. Quiet night. Sign prohibited to camp at the entrance of the dirt road, no problem in the off-season. Possibility to go even further on the parking of the mirador.

title: (29410) Yunquera - Calle Castillo
description: Parking in the quiet street and night at the entrance to Yunquera village. Just behind the gas station, which has propane. Very near the beginning of many hiking trails. After the street in the center of Yunquera, with many tapas bars and restaurants on the road that passes through it.

title: (29650) Mijas -
description: It is a public, free and small car park published in a viewpoint. Our vehicle is six meters long and it has entered just right, for campers it is ideal, you do have to be very lucky to find a space.

title: (29410) Yunquera - 13 Calle Reyes Catolicos
description: Free parking In the center of town, with some narrow streets for motorhomes. With playground and large esplanada for games with children. In the Sierra de las Nieves.

title: (29650) Mijas -
description: Small parking lot without problem to sleep in front of public parking 8 spaces

title: (29650) Mijas - 8 Carretera Coín
description: It is already along the road very close to the center

title: (29004) Málaga - 21 Carretera de la Azucarera Intelhorce
title_short: (29004) Málaga - 21 Carretera de la Azucarera Intelhorce
description: Drinking water at gas station good flow long pipes

title: (29550) Ardales - 5 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description: Off season parking from the Camino del Rey North, passed under the earth tunnel next to the restaurant, hard ground but not completely flat, possible to sleep there, arrival at night and I was not told anything, there is just enough room to turn around (with a H2L2 truck) and not too busy after 18:00 (that says in October), a lot of passages during the day to go to the trail. To go to the camino El Rey, remember to book at least a week before your ticket, otherwise you can have one of the 50 places available early in the morning, go to 7:30 / 8am, there are people even in the off season!

title: (29650) Mijas - s/n Avenida del Compás
description: Water point down the Ermita Virgen de la Pena. Parking spaces nearby. Facing the miniature museum.

title: (29650) Mijas - 8D Avenida del Compás
description: Big limit !!! FOR NORMAL VANS ONLY. Parking hall in the center "Mijas Pueblo". Easily accessible by car. Steep hill. For the day only

title: (29650) Mijas - 11 Camino de los Caños
description: Parking on the other side of Plaza Virgen de la Peña.

title: (29550) Ardales - El Caminito del Rey
description: Parking on the road, with two stands suitable for long campers and other places 4/5 small campers or vans. Views of the lake, the neighborhood is quiet, but in the open space there are buses that make maneuvering for a little blurry.

title: (29550) Ardales - 6 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description: Quiet parking in the heart of nature

title: (29004) Málaga - 82A Carretera de la Azucarera Intelhorce
title_short: (29004) Málaga - 82A Carretera de la Azucarera Intelhorce
description: Parking in the industrial area, flanked by a pine forest. We stayed here for the night in the van. A little noisy at night and early in the morning due to trucks and cars on the main road.

title: (29010) Málaga - 19 Avenida Parménides
description: Open ground enclosure. It does not have drainage services or electricity. Guarded during the day. 50 meters away there is a Mercadona and 100 meters away there is a Hospital with Emergencies. At 100 meters you find a bar area with meals of all kinds and cocktail bars. At night it is usually calm and without problems.

title: (29010) Málaga - 5 Calle Andrómeda
description: Dirt parking next to the main avenue in Teatinos (Calle Plutarco). No services. There is usually a gorilla. It is a car park that is usually quite full at night as there are many bars nearby. We have spent a fairly quiet night although with a little noise due to the nearby bars. Surrounded by buildings. Not bad for a one night stopover. We have slept alone.

title: (29110) Monda - 367 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Quiet area outside the town where there is a fountain to fill the tanks.

title: (29550) Ardales - 26 Barriada Pantano del Chorro
description:
Parking on other side of dam close to camino del rey.
 Suitable for vw T5 size vehicles when the other side of the dam is full.
We had a drink and meal in the local hotel, friendly staff and good local information.

name: Camping Sierra de las Nieves.
title: (29410) Camping Sierra de las Nieves.
description: Camping Sierra de las Nieves.

title: (29410) F - 12 Partida Campillo
description: Away from the road. Possibility to go to the end of the road. J, turned around with my CC of 7m50.

title: (29109) Tolox - 97 Carretera Balneario
description: Spacious quiet parking. if you ask at the town hall they can provide you with electricity. Many free sources in the village. Traditional bakery 5 min. Recommended restaurants "la alberca" and "casa Lola"

title: (29410) Yunquera - 149 Calle Camino de los Arbolitos
title_short: (29410) Yunquera - 149 Calle Camino de los Arbolitos
description: Next to the yunquera sports center

title: (29010) Málaga - Avenida de José Ribera
description: Quiet place, residential, university, with a lot of restaurant and drinks, five minutes walk you have metro and bus 8.23 ​​... that take you to the center of the city. You can spend the night being discreet and respecting the neighbors

title: (29140) Málaga - 24 Carretera de Álora
description: Ideal parking with bars and restaurants. Park for children next.

title: (29109) Tolox - 104A Calle Polito
description: Water, unchlorinated and looks very clean

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description:
Small place in the forest south of the car park already signposted by the roadside, passage of the GR340.
Forest path, possible access in vans, the CC may be a little high for the tree branches.
You can hear the road and air traffic in the evening and in the morning but no noise there at night.
We only stayed one night, we didn't see any parking restrictions, to check.

title: (29320) Gobantes - Unnamed Road
description: Unadorned spacious gravel roadside parking lot.

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Just near El Chorro great mountain spot to park! Quiet

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: In the wind, there is a suitable place for about 5 vehicles, graveled, surrounded by trees, no services or prohibition signs or height limitation, cell phone good, some noise in the morning from planes that drive to Malaga airport. Please leave clean again.

title: (29420) El Burgo -
description: Nice picnic area. Night possible.

title: (29109) Tolox - s/n Avenida Balneario
description: Nice quiet place and perfect for hiking. A policeman came by and even allowed me to stay overnight. There are picnic areas, water, rubbish bins and you can swim in the river as you walk down the slope.

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Very beautiful place, very windy, foxes come to visit you at night for food. There is a sign that says it is forbidden to camp with a fine. We were here last year and the reservoir is empty compared to last time.

title: (29320) Campillos -
description: With a fantastic view of the lake, next to the road but very quiet.

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description:
Nice private spot just behind the road. Flat surface.

I did not stay here, I was in one of the spots earlier down the road but found this when hiking around.

title: (29320) Campillos - Unnamed Road
description: Nice quiet place protected from the wind, without any service!

title: (29109) Tolox - Carril de Tolox a Golondrina
title_short: (29109) Tolox - Carril de Tolox a Golondrina
description: Small promontory (only 3 vehicles) flat with a beautiful view of the valley. Road very little busy. Just above the football field. No water on site but there is a little lower. Close to hiking trails

title: (29010) Málaga - 12 Calle Juan Francés Bosca
description: Large parking without services, noisy during the day due to the nearby roads, but quiet at night. a 5-minute walk away is a beautiful park with a lake, great for dogs or children

title: (29010) Málaga - 3 Bulevar Louis Pasteur
description: Free large paved car park opposite Uni - with some trees, no prohibition sign, stayed 2 nights, feels safe - metro station 5-10 mins walk / no services

title: (29010) Málaga - 27 Calle Maestro Jiménez
description: Parking in the shade. I almost always find it free.

title: (29010) Málaga - 9 Avenida Pablo Gargallo
description:
Large vacant lot in the middle of the buildings. Very quiet and very close to the direct bus to the city center. We spent one night and left the camper for the day without any problem.
Possible large sizes because large area and very good for walking dogs

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Flat spot next to the road but really quiet at night. Suitable for 1 or 2 vans. Beautiful view over the lake. Nice sunset. 4G good. It’s nature so keep it clean!

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Very nice spot on the side of the road but very little traffic at night, breathtaking view of the lake... for the anecdote, a fox visited us to snack...

title: (29010) Málaga - Calle Marea Alta
description: Parking 5 minutes walk from the feria at night. Paying 1 euro. No shade, otherwise no problem.

title: (29010) Málaga - 32 Carril del Capitán
description:
Street parking. Quiet zone. Next to playground and many green areas. Close to different bus stops to visit the center of Malaga.
The traffic on the street can be a bit annoying. But the area is quiet and safe to leave the vehicle and visit the city.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Fantastic view of the reservoir. One place. Maximum 7 meters in length. The night very lonely and calm. The route is close to the road, but in 16 hours we counted only 3 cars. There is also a path that leads to Det Lake, however, seems to be only passable by Vans or 4x4.

title: (29010) Málaga - 3 Calle Decano Agustín Moreno
description: Parking area normally quiet theatrical zone and near the exit to the highway a few kilometers from Cercampa which is buying caravan sales and workshop with gray and black drainage area and filling, without services, bars, bakeries, supermarket, bus stop to the city center and metro and city of Justice, near the university etc at 500 meters, you can spend the night without problems usually see a legal valet of day sometimes, safe and quiet.

title: (29006) Málaga - C. Paquiro
description: Municipal parking of Malaga. Capacity for 1000 vehicle.

title: (29320) Gobantes -
description: Just off the road, slightly screened, road noise not a problem as it’s a very quiet road. Amazing sunsets, no services but near hiking paths. Please take your rubbish with you.

title: (29650) Mijas - 11T Urbanizacion el Maro
description:
Esplanade between the mountains and with great views of the sea.
very calm.
highly recommended.

title: (29200) Antequera - Unnamed Road
description: Great spot with an epic view. close to the road but not much through traffic. It was a bit windy here so you might want to check the weather if you are planning on cooking or eating outdoors.

title: (29631) Benalmádena - 7 Terreno SP-8 Santangelo Oeste
description: Very quiet place in the upper parts of urbanizations. Plenty of parking, garbage nearby and a very quiet area. At the back there is a bridge that leads to the mountain with different paths, views of part of Benalmádena.
